name: 1P/Halley
description: Halley's Comet is one of the most famous comets, visible from Earth every 76 years. It was last seen in 1986 and is known for its bright tail and historical significance in various cultures.

name: 2P/Encke
description: Encke's Comet has the shortest orbital period of any known comet, approximately 3.3 years. It is notable for its periodic appearances and the bright trail it leaves in the sky.

name: 3D/Biela
description: Biela's Comet was known for its two components that split apart in the 19th century, becoming one of the first comets observed to break up.

name: 5D/Brorsen
description: Brorsen's Comet is a periodic comet that orbits the Sun every 5.5 years and is known for its bright appearance during perihelion.

name: 7P/Pons-Winnecke
description: Pons-Winnecke is a periodic comet with an orbital period of about 6.4 years, and it was last observed in 2020.

name: 8P/Tuttle
description: Tuttle's Comet has an orbital period of approximately 13.5 years and is known for its bright nucleus and prominent tail.

name: 12P/Pons-Brooks
description: This comet has an orbital period of about 71 years and is notable for its historical appearances and observations.

name: 13P/Olbers
description: Olbers' Comet has an orbital period of around 71 years and is named after the German astronomer Heinrich Wilhelm Olbers.

name: 15P/Finlay
description: Finlay's Comet has an orbital period of approximately 6.5 years and is notable for its bright appearance during its returns.

name: 18D/Perrine-Mrkos
description: This comet is a periodic one with a relatively short orbital period and has been observed multiple times since its discovery.

name: 20D/Westphal
description: Westphal's Comet is a periodic comet that has been observed and studied for its distinctive features.

name: 21P/Giacobini-Zinner
description: This comet is the parent body of the Draconid meteor shower and has an orbital period of about 6.6 years.

name: 23P/Brorsen-Metcalf
description: Brorsen-Metcalf is a periodic comet with a period of around 6.4 years, known for its bright and spectacular displays.

name: 24P/Schaumasse

name: 26P/Grigg-Skjellerup

name: 34D/Gale
description: Gale's Comet is known for its periodic returns and its historical significance in comet studies.

name: 46P/Wirtanen
description: Wirtanen's Comet is known for its close approach to Earth in 2018, providing a spectacular view for astronomers and skywatchers.

name: 55P/Tempel-Tuttle
description: This comet is the parent of the Leonid meteor shower and has an orbital period of approximately 33 years.

name: 66P/du Toit
description: Du Toit's Comet is a periodic comet that has been observed for its bright nucleus and distinct tail.

name: 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko
description: This comet was visited by the European Space Agency's Rosetta mission, which studied its surface and produced the first-ever images of a comet's surface closely.
